creator: miles@openly.com
text:
this method causes problems: 
writer.write(s.getBytes());

where "s" is a String object and "write" is an OutputStream which was 
created by calling getOutputStream() on the HttpServletResponse object. 
If s happens to be a blank string, then after calling this method, nothing 
more can be written to the output stream. Since our app is creating 
dynamic HTML pages this way (replacing dynamic tags and appending to 
the output stream, I was getting half finished pages. Could this be a 
Tomcat 4.0 bug? It did work on earlier versions I think.

creator: remm@apache.org
text: Should have been fixed in the latest nightly build.
